message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the Global Financial Inclusion (Global Findex) Database, we examine the relationship between financial inclusion and firm performance in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Global Financial Inclusion (Global Findex) Database"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Our study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data to explore the determinants of child mortality in the region.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "We employ high-frequency loan-level data from a commercial bank operating in Uzbekistan to identify causes and consequences of customer delinquency.", "dataset": ["high-frequency loan-level data"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "This paper analyzes the impacts of climate change on crop yields using data from the Integrated Assessment Modeling framework.", "dataset": ["Integrated Assessment Modeling framework"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data - the Social Welfare Development Indicator System (SWDIS) and the Overseas Korean Foundation for Children and Families record system - to identify the most vulnerable populations during the COVID-19 pandemic in South Korea.", "dataset": ["Social Welfare Development Indicator System (SWDIS)", "Overseas Korean Foundation for Children and Families record system"], "topic": ["Health", "Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "The study uses panel data on Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita and internet usage across multiple countries over a span of several years.", "dataset": ["panel data on Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita", "internet usage"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the effect of infrastructure development on job creation in African countries using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS).", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "The study investigates the effectiveness of public-private partnerships in mitigating climate change impacts on water resources management, utilizing data from the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) and the European PPP Expertise Center (EPEC).", "dataset": ["United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC)", "European PPP Expertise Center (EPEC)"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Water", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the impact of urbanization on forest cover in Indonesia using satellite imagery data as well as demographic and economic data from the Indonesia National Socioeconomic Survey (SUSENAS).", "dataset": ["satellite imagery data", "Indonesia National Socioeconomic Survey (SUSENAS)"], "topic": ["Urban Development", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Our paper analyzes the effects of foreign land acquisitions on household welfare and land-use dynamics, employing data from the Land Matrix Partnership and the Living Standards Measurement Study - Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA).", "dataset": ["Land Matrix Partnership", "Living Standards Measurement Study - Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Poverty"]}]
